snippet.textDisplay: One of the first games I played with family that lived far away. We had some great adventures.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the first games I played with family that lived far away. We had some great adventures.

snippet.textDisplay: Has anyone played this game recently? If you make a "burning character" (one per server per account) you level up 3 times each time you gain a level (from levels 8/10~ to level 149). This solves the boring leveling at levels 35~+ but destroys the slow and steady pacing the intro (the first 25 levels) of the game has. They changed too much around the early parts of the game now too, in addition. Some of the NPCs can't be spoken to anymore and you can just instantly start at level 8/10 already placed at the job trainer you want. It kinda destroys the adventure, but it does reflect the rest of the game. Just grindy and lack of adventure after you get a few dozens levels into the game, as the original devs are long gone and only riding on monetary goals.
snippet.textOriginal: Has anyone played this game recently? If you make a "burning character" (one per server per account) you level up 3 times each time you gain a level (from levels 8/10~ to level 149). This solves the boring leveling at levels 35~+ but destroys the slow and steady pacing the intro (the first 25 levels) of the game has. They changed too much around the early parts of the game now too, in addition. Some of the NPCs can't be spoken to anymore and you can just instantly start at level 8/10 already placed at the job trainer you want. It kinda destroys the adventure, but it does reflect the rest of the game. Just grindy and lack of adventure after you get a few dozens levels into the game, as the original devs are long gone and only riding on monetary goals.

snippet.textDisplay: Hearing this the moment you get off the boat is so humbling and exciting. The start of an adventure. You might have spent 6 months getting the 3rd job but it was all worth it. You mightve gone back to Lith Harbor maybe 3 or 4 times but this song will remain with you because its the start, its how it all began. Your journey, your grind, your Maple life. This song brings back so many fond memories.
snippet.textOriginal: Hearing this the moment you get off the boat is so humbling and exciting. The start of an adventure. You might have spent 6 months getting the 3rd job but it was all worth it. This song brings back so many fond memories.

snippet.textDisplay: Man, I used to tell my friends that the slimes outside Lith gave more experience than in other places just so I could have an excuse to listen to this song back when I was in middle school.  Sitting here now and listening to it while writing the final essay of my college career, it really helps put things into perspective.  Thanks for the good times, Maplestory.
snippet.textOriginal: Man, I used to tell my friends that the slimes outside Lith gave more experience than in other places just so I could have an excuse to listen to this song back when I was in middle school.  Sitting here now and listening to it while writing the final essay of my college career, it really helps put things into perspective.  Thanks for the good times, Maplestory.

snippet.textDisplay: I used to play Maplestory, until the day my connection to the server wasn't working anymore. I never knew why.  I was considering to play it again, but I was told it's for little kids. Seriously? The website says it's aimed at people 13 and over! If people researched more, I believe, then we wouldn't have this problem.

snippet.textDisplay: Having recently given maplestory another go after many years since i played it only until about level 30, the music actually took me by surprise and i enjoyed just about every track that played entering map after map. It reminds me of old jrpgs like chrono cross that brings it above every other mundane ost found in the majority of mmorpgs.

snippet.textDisplay: I've played MapleStory since 2007, although this is a great track there are many more.  Most of my favorite tracks and nostalgia has to be in Ludibrium.  Viking parties, and Grim parties with a DK (I was a Priest) were some of the best gaming moments of my life.  There is a track in Temple of Time called Time Gate which isn't the theme of any hunting ground but a transport map and is one of my favorites.  Keep up the good work SupraDarky!
snippet.textOriginal: I've played MapleStory since 2007, although this is a great track there are many more.  Most of my favorite tracks and nostalgia has to be in Ludibrium.  Viking parties, and Grim parties with a DK (I was a Priest) were some of the best gaming moments of my life.  There is a track in Temple of Time called Time Gate which isn't the theme of any hunting ground but a transport map and is one of my favorites.  Keep up the good work SupraDarky!

snippet.textDisplay: Man, Maplestory.. one of my first MMOs, I think after Ragnarok Online. I knew from the start that it was silly and childish and the community is filled with 12-year old boys (which I pretty much was at the time), but it's still a great game. The areas are absolutely beautiful and the music is fantastic. You should check out the song called "Tree Dungeon" and "Sleepywood". They're both very similar, but my favorite tracks from the game. So many memories!
snippet.textOriginal: Man, Maplestory.. one of my first MMOs, I think after Ragnarok Online. I knew from the start that it was silly and childish and the community is filled with 12-year old boys (which I pretty much was at the time), but it's still a great game. The areas are absolutely beautiful and the music is fantastic. You should check out the song called "Tree Dungeon" and "Sleepywood". They're both very similar, but my favorite tracks from the game. So many memories!

snippet.textDisplay: I'd forgotten this game entirely. Listening to this brought back many memories. I used to play this game with a good friend of mine (who at that point, I friend-zoned pretty hard) and her sister. Needless to say I did fall in love with that girl and were together for 4 years. I've moved on, but I reckon that was one of the best relationships I've ever had. This game reminds of so so much. You've made my night! :D

snippet.textDisplay: Wow, after 1219 songs on the list, 1220 was a MapleStory song. I love this song and the game. snippet.textDisplay: I think the only reason I was able to play any Korean-style MMO is because they always have really awesome music. Yay, I'm glad you decided to start posting MapleStory music~
I haven't played in eons, but it has some wonderful tracks. One of my most favorites, you might like, is Ellin Forest (Note; not "ellinia," just "ellin").
If you like, too, I have a large playlist of the songs on my account, for convenience.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm not sure how long it's been since you played it, but the past year or so they seem to have been improving the gameplay, mostly by lowering the grinding needed to level up. The last time I played it, I barely needed to grind at all. They've been adding more of a story too.

But yeah, they do always have nice soundtracks. Ragnorak had a really good one too.

But yeah, they do always have nice soundtracks. Ragnorak had a really good one too.

snippet.textDisplay: It always amazes me how much work can go into the art and music for Asian Free-2-Play games only for them to be unbearable to actually play.  Its a shame since they are often pretty and the OSTs are good.  Maplestory is a good example.

snippet.textDisplay: I've been getting a lot of requests for MapleStory music over the years.﻿ It's been one of the more popular free mmorpgs but I don't know if still has a very active community. I've never played this game so I listened to the OST, it has a pretty charming sound. This is one of the themes that stood out, I especially like the guitar and its delay. The break at 2:58 is nice and relaxing.
